description: Generate comparative analysis documents across all 7 CodeRef MCP servers by processing existing .coderef/ data to create DEPENDENCIES.md, SHARED-CODE.md, ECOSYSTEM-ARCHITECTURE.mmd, REFACTOR-TARGETS.md, and PATTERNS-ANALYSIS.md for v1→v2 refactor planning
goal: Enable data-driven refactor planning by discovering cross-server dependencies, duplicated code, complexity hotspots, and pattern inconsistencies across the CodeRef ecosystem without manual code reading
requirements: Process all 7 × .coderef/index.json files to extract cross-server imports
Compare function/class names across servers to identify duplicated code (18+ generators)
Aggregate complexity metrics from reports/complexity/ to find refactor targets
Analyze patterns.json files to discover inconsistencies in error handling, logging, and validation
Generate visual ecosystem architecture diagram combining individual server diagrams
Output 6 markdown documents in workorder folder for planning reference
constraints: Must use existing .coderef/ data only (no source file reading)
All analysis must be automated/scripted for reproducibility
Documents must be markdown for version control and readability
Processing must complete in under 30 minutes total
Must work on Windows file paths
